Text:
(I quietly gaze out the train as it chugs along the
tracks.)
(My mind turns back to two years ago.)

(One day, the Seven Shadows gathered before me just
as I was yearning to get stronger for school.)

(They wanted to share their reports on the Cult and
lab findings on the curse and all that jazz. It's
unusual to have all seven together at once since it
seems they've got their hands full as of late.)

(Jeez, go easy on the research and investigations.
There's no point to them anyway, I think as I listen
to their reports.)
(And then—)
Shadow...
The time has come for us to leave you.
...Huh?
(Here's a simple summary.)

(Based on their findings, the Cult of Diablos is
supposedly a massive organization that operates on
a global scale.)
(Fascinating.)

(The girls plan on scattering across the world to
prevent them from spreading.)

(According to them, the heroes who slayed Diablos the
demon were all women,)

(which is why it's only women who suffer from
the curse.)

(How creative, but I hate to break it to them that
all heroes were typically men.)

(Oh, wait, I bet they came up with that since,
apart from me, the Shadow Garden is comprised of
only women.)

(Their next report was on how the curse was most
common among elves,)
(followed by hybrid beasts and then humans.)

(According to their research, it has to do with the
species' respective life spans. As humans live
shorter lives with weaker traces of the heroic
bloodline, they're least susceptible to the curse.)

(On the other hand, elves have long life expectancies
with potent concentrations of blood, making them the
most prone to fall victim to the curse. Hybrid beasts,
or therianthropes, are in the middle.)

(Now that I think about it, I'm the only human in the
Shadow Garden,)

(and I've never been possessed. Which leaves us
 a posse of two therianthropes and five elves—)

(All of whom have been possessed. You know, they
did a stellar job coming up with this backstory.)

(In terms of being the possessed or cursed or
whatever,)

(they tell me the Cult calls them "compatibles," and
their members are supposedly going the extra mile to
locate, acquire, and wipe them from existence.)

(Anyway, their plan is for the Shadow Garden to
scatter across the world while leaving me with
one rotating subordinate.)

(The rest of them will protect the possessed while
investigating the Cult and sabotaging their
activities.)

(They tell me this is the only way to fight the
Cult.)
(As I listen to their reports, it suddenly hits me.)
(The girls have grown up.)

(They must have realized that the Cult doesn't exist.
They're through with this stupid charade and are
demanding their freedom.)
(What else could scattering across the world mean?)

(I'm guessing they feel indebted to me for curing
them which is why they're sticking with me on
a rotating basis.)

(I just have to deal with it. I know that's what
they're trying to tell me.)

(I was feeling all sappy, but I agreed and sent them
on their way.)

(If they leave me with one subordinate, that's enough
for me. I hadn’t intended to end up with a team of
seven in the first place.)

(It is what it is. In my past life, I was also
alone...)

(As we grow up, we don't even notice that we've
forgotten all about our precious heroes...)

(So, just like in my past life, I'll fight this
lonely battle on my own.)
Heh...
(This doesn't change anything.)
(I'll never stop trying to become a shadowbroker...)

(...even if that means I have to face this world
alone.)
Huh? Wonder what's going on.

A-Are there any dark knights on board?! Bandits have
boarded the train!

Give it a break, mate. We a'ready checked—ain't no
decent dark knights 'board this rust bucket.
Wh-What do you mean, sir?
Not too bright, are ya? Ya see, I'm the inside man.
Eeeeeeek!!!

None of ya move an inch. Time for y'all to have a
little nap.
Wh-What do you mean?

Heheh! Sleeping gas, mate. We put it throughout this
here train. Gonna kick in any moment now—no point
resisting.
Ngh... What's happening...
Sleep tight.
Well then, time to get ta work. Come on in, boys.

Heheh. Our tip was right on the money. These
bastards are loaded.
Hell yeah. Let's rob 'em blind.

Lookee what we have 'ere...a noble's brat. He's got
something—agh?!
Aaaaghhh!
Wh-What is it?!
Th-This brat cut me arm off!
Why the hell are ya awake?!

I've been wondering what I should do in cases like
this.

Sticking to my role as an extra wouldn't be a bad
idea, but I'd hate to part ways with my money.
That said, you're really not worth my time as
a shadowbroker. I've outgrown your type.
What are ya blabberin' on about?! Time for ya to die!

But I am a little curious about the abilities of the
bandits in the capital. I'll take you guys on outside
the train.
The bastard's getting away! After 'im, boys!!!
